context: The Finnish verb 'tehdä' is a versatile word that means 'to do', 'to make', or 'to create'. It's one of the most common verbs in Finnish and can be used in various contexts such as performing actions (doing homework), producing things (making food), or creating projects. The verb changes form depending on the subject and tense: 'teen' (I do/make), 'teet' (you do/make), 'tekee' (he/she/it does/makes), 'teemme' (we do/make), 'teette' (you plural/formal do/make), and 'tekevät' (they do/make).
